text:
July 24, 1962
Mr. Maurice Seay
Director, Division of Education
W. K. Kellogg Foundation
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Maurice:
June 30th brought to a close eleven years of Kellogg support for the
NAEB an association marked, I believe, by mutual professional and personal
respect and regard.
The initial grant enabling NAEB to establish a headquarters office and set
up the Tape Network, launched the Association into a new era of expanded
service and professional operation; the continuing Kellogg Foundation support
enabled us to strengthen and consolidate these gains and lay the groundwork
for affording continuing service and growth. It is this unique support which
has made it possible for NAEB to command increasing respect and recognition
nationally and internationally each year. No single development in the history
of NAEB has had so affirmative an impact.
And, over the course of more than a decade, you and your associates have
been sympathetic and understanding, listening to our trials and tribulations,
putting up with our foibles and follies. For this, too, we are grateful.
It is our conclusion, in which we hope you share, that through its generous
support of NAEB, the WJC. Kellogg Foundation has helped in a very positive way
to help insure that the benefits of the electronic media are used increasingly
to the greater dignity, integrity and efficiency of American education and our
society â€¢
In all sincerity, we of NAEB want to express again our lasting gratitude and
abiding appreciation.
Sincerely yours,
WGH:pw
William G. Harley
P JS. A final financial statement and the annual report will be along shortly.
